content: hunglish knitter cherry & peach sizes s m l xl xxl chest circumference the sizes s m l xl xxl are designed to fit an approximate bust circumference of 90-95 95-100 105- 110 110-115 115-120 cm 35 4-37 4 37 4-39 3 41 3-43 3 43 3-45 2 45 2 -47 2 inches the cardigan is designed to have approx 5 cm 2 inch of positive ease gauge 22 sts x 28 row in stockinet stitch on 4 mm us8 needles = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches needles circular needles 4 mm us6 and 3 mm us2 5 materials 8 stitch markers for the raglan bobby pins or stitch markers for the bobby pin technique and 5-8 buttons 1 5 cm/ 0 5 inch yarn weight 3 dk suggested yarn berroco vintage dk shown here rose quarts colour 52% acrylic 40% wool 8% nylon 3 5 oz / 100 g = 290 yds / 265 m estimated yardage depending on the length 400 450 500 560 600 g 1000 1100 1300 1500 1600 meter or the peach version was made with cotton merino held together with one strain of mohair easy care cotton merino with setasuri dégradé page 1 of 7 250 300 300 350 400 g cotton merino by mayflower 50 g = 186 yds /170 m held together with approximately 125 150 150 170 200 g setasuri dégradé alpaca and silk mohair 50 g = 464 yds / 424 m pattern the cardigan is worked top down in the flat on a circular needle with raglan increases on the yoke the yoke is divided for body and sleeves and the body continued back and forth the sleeves are worked in the round with magic loop technique for detailed instructions see video at hunglish knitter youtube channel https //www youtube com/@hunglishknitter raglan instructions m1r insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from back to front then knit this strand m1l insert the left needle under the strand that runs between two stitches from front to back then knit this strand through the back loop twisted yoke cast on 100 104 108 112 120 sts on a 3 mm us2 5 60 80 and/or 100 cm 24 32 and/or 40 inches circular needle with your preferred method neckband work in 1x1 rib k1 p1 knit the rib as wide as you wish in size small i knitted a 3 cm rib dividing for raglan after neckband divide the stitches for raglan increases by purling one row while placing markers on both sides of the 1 raglan stitch a total of 8 stitch markers as follows 17 18 19 19 21 sts left front 1 raglan st 14 14 14 16 16 sts left sleeve 1 raglan st 34 36 38 38 42 sts back 1 raglan st 14 14 14 16 16 sts right sleeve 1 raglan st 17 18 19 19 21 sts right front raglan increases & elevation now work
